Posts.EditableText:
Hi all, I'm new to the Quest application but am excited to get started making text adventure games. However, it seems that whatever I create, I get the following error when I try to play it in browser:

```Server Error in '/' Application.
Runtime Error
Description: An application error occurred on the server. The current custom error settings for this application prevent the details of the application error from being viewed remotely (for security reasons). It could, however, be viewed by browsers running on the local server machine.

Details: To enable the details of this specific error message to be viewable on remote machines, please create a <customErrors> tag within a "web.config" configuration file located in the root directory of the current web application. This <customErrors> tag should then have its "mode" attribute set to "Off".
```

This happens even if I open up a brand new project in the web editor and just press run without adding anything. This happens in a finished project that runs fine on the desktop application. So how can I fix it?
Posts.HTML:
Hi all, I'm new to the Quest application but am excited to get started making text adventure games. However, it seems that whatever I create, I get the following error when I try to play it in browser:

Runtime Error
Description: An application error occurred on the server. The current custom error settings for this application prevent the details of the application error from being viewed remotely (for security reasons). It could, however, be viewed by browsers running on the local server machine.

Details: To enable the details of this specific error message to be viewable on remote machines, please create a <customErrors> tag within a "web.config" configuration file located in the root directory of the current web application. This <customErrors> tag should then have its "mode" attribute set to "Off".

This happens even if I open up a brand new project in the web editor and just press run without adding anything. This happens in a finished project that runs fine on the desktop application. So how can I fix it?

Posts.EditableText: The web player application appears to be down - none of the games work. The site administrator needs to fix this.
Posts.HTML: The web player application appears to be down - none of the games work. The site administrator needs to fix this.

Posts.EditableText: This happens every so often. It usually takes several days to fix. In these days of high speed technology why is this?
Posts.HTML: This happens every so often. It usually takes several days to fix. In these days of high speed technology why is this?

Posts.EditableText: Not fixed for me either, had this issue about 2 days ago.
